EducationItem.InstituteName: Anki Nilsson Kommunikationsträning Malmö, Sweden Presentationsteknik
Crisp Stockholm, Sweden; Jeff Sutherland, Mary Poppendieck, Tom Poppendieck & Henrik Kniberg
Alliance Stockholm, Sweden; Jeff Sutherland and Henrik Kniberg

EducationItem.DegreeDirection: Semcon Project Management; Project planning and management
aWaves; Mobile Networks with focus on service implementation
Master of Science, Information and Communication Technology

EmploymentItem.Description: ** Developed and arcitechted Frontend, developed backend. ** Part of the team that brought Youcruit from an idea to an up and running business.

** Worked as an Agile Coach focusing on making Scrum and Kanban work for teams. ** Software development and Lean consultant. Worked with developing excellent software and helping organizations improve their performance.

** Worked closely with fellow Engineers on a large system consisting of Servers and clients throughout the lifecycle. Delivered solutions for several customers including setting up and running operations. Participated in product management with roadmap and planning for new functionality. ** Managed a multi-project environment with teams and team members located in Malmö, Kiev, Huskvarna and Umeå. Customers were mostly mobile network operators located in the EMEA and APAC regions. Brought the release cycle down from 6 - 12 months to 2 - 4 weeks. Worked in close cooperation with application planners and project owners. ** Brought derailed high profile projects back on track. The project was initiated at the customers Tokyo office and included mobile phone applications implementing several DLNA use cases. ** Coordinated efforts to raise the quality of a large embedded system. ** Developed applications in a variety of environments ranging from embedded C to Java EE.

Master's Thesis ** Developed a method for estimation of software performance requirements in the EMP platform with focus on multimedia software. The original task was to create a simulation environment and part of the findings was that this was not feasible.

holidays ** Responsible for operations and maintenance of servers, workstations and networks. The environment was based on Windows NT and 2000, though Linux, HP-UX, IBM AIX and IBM OS/400 were also present. ** Developed support applications in Visual Basic.

** Consultant working with operations of Windows NT server and client systems, Linux firewalls and Cisco routers. ** Development and consulting of network surveillance applications mainly written in Perl. ** Installation and configuration of Microsoft IIS and Apache web servers.

Worked as an Agile Coach for a Large Enterprise introducing Agile and Lean ways of working. Personally trained, coached and ran team building excersizes for more than 20 teams. Coached and educated managers. Set up and ran a program for training to be coaches.

Techniques: Javascript, Java, BackboneJS, JQuery, Maven, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST, Developed the frontend and backend for a video CV service. A responsive one page javascript state of the art web application.
Softhouse 2011 24 Months Techniques: Java, Javascript, GWT, C++, Python Role: Developer Agile developer of web management interface against a building automation system. Architected major updates to system regarding functionality and security.
Developed a social marketing solution for a startup. The solution was a module that was included in the checkout flow of webshops.

Managing several software projects against a customer in Japan at a mobile phone platform and modem vendor in the telecommunications industry. Responsible for deliveries and development of software directly towards the customer with teams at several locations in Europe and Japan.

Techniques: Scrum, Android, ASP.NET, Maven, Hudson Developed an Android client application against an existing ASP.NET backend system. Managed implementation of Scrum within the team, set the application architecture, set up and implemented continuous integration and TDD. Debugged the backend system. Focused on optimizing the system with usability for the end user as the main goal.

Led several development teams, an operations department and project Managers. Worked with customization projects for telecom operators around the globe as well as r&d. Took active part in technical problem
1 Month Techniques: SOAP, REST, Java, LDAP Set up, configured and customized a CMS system based on the Alfresco open source system.

Led several teams developing Java ME based multimedia applications for a major mobile handset manufacturer. Was responsible for handing over projects to teams in Brazil. Brought back a project in crisis from Tokyo.

EmploymentItem.JobTitle: Critical Chain; Project Leader, Team Leader
EmploymentItem.Description: 14 months Brought several Java ME based applications in the sports / active lifestyle segment to market for a major mobile handset manufacturer. Worked with different parties throughout the lifecycle. Introduced Scrum when the project was "doomed" and brought it back on schedule.

Techniques: C, Java, Lauterbach, TCP/IP, OSE Worked as a problem solving consultant at a major mobile handset manufacturer. Coordinated efforts between several suppliers and different groups within the customer's organization.

12 month Techniques: Java, SOAP, OMA-DS, HTTP, Hibernate, JDBC, JSP, Servlet, Apache Tomcat Architected a major rewrite of an OMA-DS server suite. Developed SOAP based public API:s. Optimized applications across the software stack including web client code and database queries.
Techniques: Java EE, HTTP, SMPP, OMA-DM, SOAP, Struts, Oracle, Weblogic Set up an OMA-DM server and built a demo application on top of it for the 3 GSM fair.
Developed a stunning data visualization application for a major mobile handset manufacturer.

CustomArea.Last3Experiences: Senior Consultant, Software Engineer / Project Leader, Network Technician

Profile.DocumentText:
CV
CHRISTIAN EKSTRAND
EXPERIENCE 2012-FF Youcruit AB Malmö, Sweden Developer, Partner ** Developed and arcitechted Frontend, developed backend. ** Part of the team that brought Youcruit from an idea to an up and running business.
2010-FF Softhouse AB Malmö, Sweden Senior Consultant ** Worked as an Agile Coach focusing on making Scrum and Kanban work for teams. ** Software development and Lean consultant. Worked with developing excellent software and helping organizations improve their performance.
2005-2010 Tactel AB Malmö, Sweden Software Engineer / Project Leader ** Worked closely with fellow Engineers on a large system consisting of Servers and clients throughout the lifecycle. Delivered solutions for several customers including setting up and running operations. Participated in product management with roadmap and planning for new functionality. ** Managed a multi-project environment with teams and team members located in Malmö, Kiev, Huskvarna and Umeå. Customers were mostly mobile network operators located in the EMEA and APAC regions. Brought the release cycle down from 6 - 12 months to 2 - 4 weeks. Worked in close cooperation with application planners and project owners. ** Brought derailed high profile projects back on track. The project was initiated at the customers Tokyo office and included mobile phone applications implementing several DLNA use cases. ** Coordinated efforts to raise the quality of a large embedded system. ** Developed applications in a variety of environments ranging from embedded C to Java EE.
2005 Ericsson AB Lund, Sweden Master's Thesis ** Developed a method for estimation of software performance requirements in the EMP platform with focus on multimedia software. The original task was to create a simulation environment and part of the findings was that this was not feasible.
1998 - 2003 Plastal AB Simrishamn, Sweden Network Technician during summer holidays ** Responsible for operations and maintenance of servers, workstations and networks. The environment was based on Windows NT and 2000, though Linux, HP-UX, IBM AIX and IBM OS/400 were also present. ** Developed support applications in Visual Basic.
2000 Internet Pro AB Lund, Sweden Network Technician ** Consultant working with operations of Windows NT server and client systems, Linux firewalls and Cisco routers. ** Development and consulting of network surveillance applications mainly written in Perl. ** Installation and configuration of Microsoft IIS and Apache web servers.
COURSES 2013 Anki Nilsson Kommunikationsträning Malmö, Sweden Presentationsteknik 2013 Softhouse Education Malmö, Sweden Certified Scrum Product Owner 2010 Indigo Management Borgholm, Sweden UGL - Understanding Group and Leadership 2009 Crisp Stockholm, Sweden Deep Lean course given by Jeff Sutherland, Mary Poppendieck, Tom Poppendieck & Henrik Kniberg 2008 Scrum Alliance Stockholm, Sweden Certified Scrum Master Course given by Jeff Sutherland and Henrik Kniberg 2007 Semcon Project Management Lund, Sweden Project planning and management 2006 aWaves Academy Malmö, Sweden Mobile Networks with focus on service implementation
EDUCATION
2002-2005 Lund University Lund, Sweden Master of Science, Information and Communication Technology 2001-2002 Lund University Lund, Sweden Informatics 40p design and development 1999-2000 Lund University Lund, Sweden Computer Science 40p courses 1996 - 1999 Friaborgsskolan Simrishamn, Sweden Science programme with technical orientation
COMPETENCES Methods Scrum, Kanban, Lean, Critical Chain
Platforms Linux, Android, Windows, Solaris, OSE
Protocols TCP/IP, HTTP, REST, SOAP, OMA-DS, OMA- DM, SMPP, OMA-CP, RTSP
Languages Javascript, Java, C, C++
Tools Eclipse, Sublime, Visual Studio, Hansoft, GIT, SVN, CVS, Clearcase, Jenkins, Anthill, Bugzilla, Clearquest, CME, Ant, Maven
Databases PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL, Oracle
VOLOUNTEER WORK
2002 - 2005 Sydskånska Nationen Lund, Sweden Member of the Seniorskollegium 2002 Lundakarnevalen Lund, Sweden Network Manager 2001 - 2002 Sydskånska Nationen Lund, Sweden PR and IT Manager 1998 - 1999 Friaborgsskolan Simrishamn, Sweden Founded the computer club
LANGUAGES Swedish Fluent in spoken and written language. Native language.
English Fluent in spoken and written language.
German Intermediate in spoken and written language.
PERSONAL
Swedish drivers license class B
Interests include photography, travelling and sports such as skiing, diving, cycling, sailing.
COMPLETE PROJECT LIST
Softhouse 2013 9 Months Techniques: Scrum, Kanban, Five Dysfunctions of a Team, Teambuilding Role: Agile Coach Worked as an Agile Coach for a Large Enterprise introducing Agile and Lean ways of working. Personally trained, coached and ran team building excersizes for more than 20 teams. Coached and educated managers. Set up and ran a program for training to be coaches.
Youcruit 2012 Ongoing Techniques: Javascript, Java, BackboneJS, JQuery, Maven, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST, Role: Developer Developed the frontend and backend for a video CV service. A responsive one page javascript state of the art web application.
Softhouse 2011 24 Months Techniques: Java, Javascript, GWT, C++, Python Role: Developer Agile developer of web management interface against a building automation system. Architected major updates to system regarding functionality and security.
Side Project 2011 6 Months Techniques: Java, Javascript, JQuery, Maven Role: Developer Developed a social marketing solution for a startup. The solution was a module that was included in the checkout flow of webshops.
Softhouse 2010 3 Months Techniques: Android, OSE Role: Software Project Manager Managing several software projects against a customer in Japan at a mobile phone platform and modem vendor in the telecommunications industry. Responsible for deliveries and development of software directly towards the customer with teams at several locations in Europe and Japan.
Softhouse 2010 2 Months Techniques: Scrum, Android, ASP.NET, Maven, Hudson Role: Developer Developed an Android client application against an existing ASP.NET backend system. Managed implementation of Scrum within the team, set the application architecture, set up and implemented continuous integration and TDD. Debugged the backend system. Focused on optimizing the system with usability for the end user as the main goal.
Tactel 2009 12 Months Techniques: Scrum, Kanban, Java, OMA-DS Role: Program Manager Led several development teams, an operations department and project Managers. Worked with customization projects for telecom operators around the globe as well as r&d. Took active part in technical problem
solving and performance optimization. Brought the release cycle down from 12 months to 4 weeks.
Tactel 2009 1 Month Techniques: SOAP, REST, Java, LDAP Role: Developer, System Engineer Set up, configured and customized a CMS system based on the Alfresco open source system.
Tactel 2008 12 Months Techniques: Scrum, Java ME, DLNA Role: Project leader, Scrum Master Led several teams developing Java ME based multimedia applications for a major mobile handset manufacturer. Was responsible for handing over projects to teams in Brazil. Brought back a project in crisis from Tokyo.
Tactel 2007 14 months Techniques: Critical Chain, Scrum, Java ME, GPS, Accelerometer Role: Project Leader, Team Leader Brought several Java ME based applications in the sports / active lifestyle segment to market for a major mobile handset manufacturer. Worked with different parties throughout the lifecycle. Introduced Scrum when the project was "doomed" and brought it back on schedule.
Tactel 2007 6 months Techniques: C, Java, Lauterbach, TCP/IP, OSE Role: Developer Worked as a problem solving consultant at a major mobile handset manufacturer. Coordinated efforts between several suppliers and different groups within the customer's organization.
Tactel 2006 12 month Techniques: Java, SOAP, OMA-DS, HTTP, Hibernate, JDBC, JSP, Servlet, Apache Tomcat Role: Developer, Architect Architected a major rewrite of an OMA-DS server suite. Developed SOAP based public API:s. Optimized applications across the software stack including web client code and database queries.
Tactel 2006 3 months Techniques: Java EE, HTTP, SMPP, OMA-DM, SOAP, Struts, Oracle, Weblogic Role: Developer Set up an OMA-DM server and built a demo application on top of it for the 3 GSM fair.
Tactel 2005 3 months Techniques: Java ME Role: Developer Developed a stunning data visualization application for a major mobile handset manufacturer.
